questions.question: What is Safe Exam Browser?
questions.answer: Safe Exam Browser (SEB) is a secure browser environment for taking online exams safely. It turns any computer into a secure workstation by controlling access to utilities like task switchers, screen capture, and other applications.

questions.question: Is SEB free to use?
questions.answer: Yes, SEB is completely free and open-source software released under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Both students and institutions can use it without any licensing fees.

questions.question: Which platforms does SEB support?
questions.answer: SEB is available for Windows, macOS, and iOS/iPadOS. Each platform has its own optimized client application.

questions.question: How do I install SEB on my computer?
questions.answer: Visit the Downloads page, select SEB Client, choose your operating system (Windows, macOS, or iOS), and download the latest version. Run the installer and follow the on-screen instructions.

questions.question: Can I use SEB on my tablet?
questions.answer: Yes, SEB is available for iOS/iPadOS devices. You can download it from the App Store or from our Downloads page.

questions.question: What should I do if SEB won't start?
questions.answer: Ensure you have the latest version installed and that your system meets the minimum requirements. If issues persist, contact your institution's IT support or check our troubleshooting documentation.

questions.question: What is the difference between SEB Server and Screen Proctoring Server?
questions.answer: SEB Server manages exam configurations and monitors client connections. Screen Proctoring Server adds real-time screen capture and monitoring capabilities for enhanced exam security.

questions.question: Can we host SEB Server on our own infrastructure?
questions.answer: Yes, SEB Server is designed to be self-hosted. You have full control over the installation and can deploy it on your own servers.

questions.question: Does SEB integrate with our LMS?
questions.answer: SEB works with most major Learning Management Systems including Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard, and others through standard integration protocols.
